title: 'This year is going to be hard for the market and hard for companies,' says Mellody Hobson
text: On this episode of Yahoo Finance Presents, Ariel Investments Co-CEO and President Mellody Hobson discusses the economic pain incurred by the coronavirus outbreak, the outlook for a recovery, and why the downturn creates a buying opportunity for investors.

title: These are the sectors that could be fundamentally changed by coronavirus: Kevin O'Leary
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses investment strategies amid the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Cramer’s week ahead: This earnings week will be a ‘tougher test’
text: “February and March were hideous, so it’s okay that April’s giving us a bounce,” CNBC’s Jim Cramer said.

title: Cramer previews earnings reports for the trading week of April 27
text: This earnings week is "chock full of tech stocks, including some household names that have run up substantially from their March lows," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Billionaire Carl Icahn on Investments, CMBX 6 Short, Oil Buy
text: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn discusses investment strategy, his short of the derivatives index CMBX 6, and his refiner CVR Energy's large-scale purchase of oil on Monday.

title: Buy Gold Now? How Stimulus Packages Will Drive Gold Prices To Record Highs | What’s Ahead
text: Why the price of gold is going up, and why you should buy some—but not too much.

title: Stock market explainer: Bull v. Bear markets
text: What's the difference between a bull and a bear market?

title: What's the Fed's next move amid the coronavirus economic collapse?
text: Yahoo Finance Zack Guzman and Brian Cheung dig in to the latest federal budget deficit figures from the CBO, and break down what to expect in next week's Federal Reserve meeting on Wednesday.

title: Explainer: How the U.S. could use taxpayer dollars to save oil and energy companies
text: The U.S. federal government is looking at "a whole bunch of alternatives" to support oil and other energy companies, Treasury Secretary Steven Mnuchin said on Friday as the industry struggles with plummeting prices and demand as the coronavirus crushes economic activity.

title: William Blair Commentary: Nonlinear Thinking in a Linear Market
text: “The saddest aspect of life right now is that science gathers knowledge faster than society gathers wisdom,” wrote science fiction writer Isaac Asimov—a thought that rings true today as policymakers struggle to catch up with what’s occurring in the world.

title: NYSE COO on when the trading floor will reopen
text: NYSE COO Michael Blaugrund joins "Closing Bell" to discuss next steps on when the New York Stock Exchange might potentially reopen.

title: US Indexes Higher Friday, but Lower for the Week of April 24
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 23,775.27 on Friday with a gain of 260.01 points or 1.11%.

title: Trends with Benefits #9: Managing Investor Expectations with Dan Cupkovic
text: It’s interesting that in many of the episodes we’ve done to date, we touch on different facets of investor behavior and financial literacy. We didn’t necessarily plan it that way, but current markets and volatility have set the perfect backdrop to review the subject from different perspectives.

title: Icahn sees opportunities but warns of more 'downdrafts' ahead: Bloomberg
text: Billionaire investor Carl Icahn said he expects to see "good opportunities" to buy after the historic stock market sell-off but warned there will likely be more heavy selling because the coronavirus outbreak has yet to be contained.

title: Dow Jones Today: Earnings, Coronavirus and Dividends, Oh My
text: Broadly speaking, Friday was somewhat uneventful, a scenario volatility weary investors will take. It was another one of those days where the novel coronavirus and earnings mostly dominated the headlines.

title: Why Carl Icahn Bought Cheap Oil During Monday’s Historic Plummet
text: Billionaire activist investor Carl Icahn discusses his refiner CVR Energy's large-scale purchase of oil on Monday after prices went negative, saying "you’ll never see that again in history.

title: Shale Giant Stops Most Drilling As U.S. Oil Rig Wipeout Worsens
text:
Continental Resources reportedly stopped nearly all drilling in the Bakken after oil prices went negative earlier this week.

title: Stocks close higher Friday but still end week in the red amid coronavirus uncertainty
text: The major U.S. equity benchmarks ended Friday's session solidly higher as investors took solace in the passage of another round of stimulus and a continued rebound in oil prices after a headlong crash earlier this week.

title: Here's what happened to the stock market on Friday (April 24)
text: Stocks closed higher as oil extended its rebound from historic lows, but still posted their first weekly loss in three.

title: Stocks Rally, Dow Jumps Nearly 300 Points After Trump Signs $484 Billion Coronavirus Relief Bill
text: Stocks are up for for a third straight day.

title: Oil rises, but ends wild week lower as coronavirus slashes fuel demand
text: Oil prices rose on Friday but still posted a weekly loss, the eighth in nine weeks, as global production cuts could not keep pace with the collapse in demand caused by the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Stocks face headwinds as investors look forward to a big earnings week, a Fed meeting and state reopenings
text: Stocks head into a week full of big events, including a Fed meeting, earnings from Microsoft, Apple and Amazon, and first-quarter gross domestic product numbers.

title: President Trump signs bill for more coronavirus aid
text: CNBC's Kayla Tausche reports on comments from President Trump regarding his conversation with Apple CEO Tim Cook on the coronavirus pandemic.

title: Trump: I want to help oil and gas industry
text: President Trump said he “loves the energy business” and that the U.S.

title: Wall Street Advances on Friday (April 24)
text: U.S. stocks were in the green on Friday ahead of the U.S. government injecting money into the economy.

title: Federal Budget Deficit Will Approach $4 Trillion In 2020, CBO Says, As The Economy Continues To Nosedive
text: The national debt is on track to eclipse the value of the entire economic output of the United States.

title: Here's how much unemployment has spiked in each state because of coronavirus
text: As the U.S. economy has slowed to stem the surge of coronavirus, unemployment levels have hit record highs.

title: Tom Barrack Says U.S. Property Market Is in 'Chaos'
text: Tom Barrack said the U.S. property market is in ”chaos” and still on the verge of collapse because the federal government and local authorities are allowing renters and homeowners to skip payments because of the coronavirus. Barrack, the chief executive officer of Colony Capital Inc. spoke exclusively to Erik Schatzker on "Bloomberg Daybreak: Americas."

title: Congressional estimators see major U.S. economic decline in mid-2020 as coronavirus stifles activity
text: The U.S. economy faces a bleak immediate future with gross domestic product likely contracting 12% in the second quarter and the federal deficit growing to $3.7 trillion, while the unemployment rate will probably crest at 16% in the third quarter, according to projections released by the Congressional Budget Office on Friday.

title: Top Spiking Articles During Oil's Volatile Week
text: These were the top searched terms and articles on Investopedia this week as readers looked to understand the crash in oil prices and how to trade it.

title: A Playbook for COVID Uncertainty – The 60/40 Portfolio

title: U.S. oil futures suffer 32% drop for the week
text: U.S. benchmark oil futures edged higher on Friday, but suffered a roughly 32% loss for the week, the largest weekly percentage decline on record, on persistent demand concerns and lack of storage capacity.

title: Virus Impact on Global GDP Will Be 'Catastrophic,' Pascal Lamy Warns
text: Former World Trade Organization Director-General Pascal Lamy says the coronavirus pandemic will cause "horrible, terrible" numbers for the global economy.

title: We're at the very beginning of this rehiring stage, says AllianceBernstein's Jim Tierney
text: Jim Tierney, AllianceBernstein, and Ron Insana, Schroders N.A. senior advisor, join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the current state of markets and where they see it headed.

title: NYSE eyes reopening trading floor, but timeline still unclear
text: The New York Stock Exchange plans to reopen its iconic trading floor, which is shuttered due to coronavirus concerns, as soon as possible, but it has not yet set a date to do so, the NYSE and people familiar with the matter said on Friday.

title: S&P 500 Index Update: Bull / Bear Line at 2825
text: S&P 500 Index Trading Outlook (3-5 Days): Bearish Price fell throughout Thursday’s session and could pullback further. That said, my eyes are on 2825 on a closing basis.

title: Mark Cuban talks the coronavirus and what he believes it will take to get the economy back on track
text: Shark Tank's Mark Cuban and owner of the Dallas Mavericks basketball team and American billionaire and entrepreneur joins Yahoo Finance’s On The Move to discuss the new stimulus relief measures.

title: How to Invest Internationally
text: Bill Mann breaks down investing in international stocks.

title: Gold futures down for the session, gain for the week
text: Gold futures fell Friday, easing back from a gain a day earlier, but posted a climb of about 2.2% for the week.

title: It's going to take time to get to where we were before coronavirus: Investing pro
text: CNBC's "Halftime Report" team discusses investment strategies amid the coronavirus pandemic with Matt Forester of BNY Mellon's Lockwood Advisors.

title: Stocks struggle with muddled government pandemic response
text: Global equity benchmarks struggled on Friday as some U.S. states began reopening businesses despite the disapproval of health experts, and as the European Union put off addressing details of its new economic rescue plan.

title: Baker Hughes reports a weekly drop of 60 in the U.S. oil-rig count
text: Baker Hughes BKR, -1.14% on Thursday reported that the number of active U.S. rigs drilling for oil dropped by 60 to 378 this week.

text: The Trump administration is considering taking stakes in U.S. energy companies as one possible option as it seeks to help the nation's oil and gas sector amid the coronavirus outbreak, U.S.

title: Why this JPMorgan strategist isn't 'nearly as bearish' as he was in March
text: Phil Camporeale of JPMorgan Asset Management and Chetan Ahya of Morgan Stanley join "Squawk Alley" to discuss the state of the markets.

title: Fed: Total commercial paper loans total $249 million
text: CNBC's Steve Liesman reports on new stimulus data released by the Federal Reserve.

title: Trump Signs $484 Billion Coronavirus Relief Bill
text: The bill will restart the Paycheck Protection Program with another $310 billion. It also shores up funding for hospitals and coronavirus testing.

title: April US Consumer Sentiment Plummets to 50-Year Low on COVID-19 Fears
text: The University of Michigan Consumer Sentiment Index plunged month over month from a March reading of 89.1 to April’s final level of 71.8.

title: 2020 Market Crash Has Small Cap Value Stocks Reeling
text: Stocks surged following the March 23 Coronavirus crash low. And it’s the same old theme – large cap tech growth firms have pretty much led the way.

title: 'Technology and health care remain our two favorite sectors,' says  Keith Lerner
text: Keith Lerner, Chief Market Strategist at SunTrust Advisory Services, joins Yahoo Finance to discuss the overall impact of the COVID-19 crisis on the U.S. economy, the U.S. Federal Reserve's response and what to expect this earnings season.

title: Discover card CEO details shocking drop in consumer spending with travel category down 99%
text: Credit card company Discover Financial Services offered a grim snapshot of just how much wary Americans have restricted their spending.
